body:
So it turns out `mpl.use('TKAgg')` was needed to render windows in Mac OS X in older versions of `matplotlib`. I removed it and increased the `matplotlib` version in the requirements.
Please confirm this solves the issue.
@w4nderlust pip is pulling only the old release version not newer one. :( because the error is still throwing which points to older code.

Yes I will update to version 0.1.1 once enough bugs are fixed. In the mean time can you please try with `pip install https://github.com/uber/ludwig/archive/master.zip` which should install the current code in the master branch?

That is likely a problem with your data. Lookin at the screenshot you posted, you are escaping commas that separate columns, you should not do that, you should only escape commas if you have them inside strings. Closing this as the original issue is solved, let me know if fixing the dataset doesn't solve the problem.

issue.title: Using Ludwig on Google colab - ImportError: Cannot load backend 'TkAgg'
issue.body:
I am trying to use Ludwig on Google colab. I can install using pip. But when I try to import Ludwig model  (from ludwig import LudwigModel) or use this through the command line interface, I get the following error --


---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-f06c687442c8> in <module>()
----> 1 from ludwig import LudwigModel

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/__init__.py in <module>()
     15 # ==============================================================================
     16 from ludwig.api import LudwigModel
---> 17 from ludwig.cli import CLI
     18 from ludwig.globals import LUDWIG_VERSION as __version__

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py in <module>()
     22 from ludwig import predict
     23 from ludwig import train
---> 24 from ludwig import visualize
     25 
     26 

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/visualize.py in <module>()
     30 
     31 from ludwig.constants import *
---> 32 from ludwig.utils import visualization_utils
     33 from ludwig.utils.data_utils import load_json, load_from_file
     34 from ludwig.utils.print_utils import logging_level_registry

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/utils/visualization_utils.py in <module>()
     26 from matplotlib.lines import Line2D
     27 
---> 28 mpl.use('TkAgg')  # make matplotlib run on mac os
     29 import matplotlib.patches as patches
     30 import matplotlib.path as path

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/matplotlib/__init__.py in use(arg, warn, force)
   1389         if force:
   1390             from matplotlib.pyplot import switch_backend
-> 1391             switch_backend(name)
   1392     # Finally if pyplot is not imported update both rcParams and
   1393     # rcDefaults so restoring the defaults later with rcdefaults

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py in switch_backend(newbackend)
    220                 "Cannot load backend {!r} which requires the {!r} interactive "
    221                 "framework, as {!r} is currently running".format(
--> 222                     newbackend, required_framework, current_framework))
    223 
    224     rcParams['backend'] = rcParamsDefault['backend'] = newbackend

ImportError: Cannot load backend 'TkAgg' which requires the 'tk' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NOTE: If your import is failing due to a missing package, you can
manually install dependencies using either !pip or !apt.

To view examples of installing some common dependencies, click the
"Open Examples" button below.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

body:
What solved the problem for me was to **restart** my kernel, import the following **first**:

`import matplotlib
matplotlib.use('TKAgg')`

**Then**, 

`import matplotlib.pyplot as plt`

What solved the problem for me was to restart my kernel, import the following first:

```
import matplotlib
matplotlib.use('TKAgg')

```
Then,
`
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt`

You probably imported matplotlib with another framework before you tried to change to TKAgg. Restart your kernel.

[reference](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55811545/importerror-cannot-load-backend-tkagg-which-requires-the-tk-interactive-fra)

issue.title: Could not build genfire Cannot load backend 'Qt5Agg' which requires the 'qt5'

repository.name: GENFIRE-Python
repository.description: Python implementation of GENFIRE (GENeralized Fourier Iterative REconstruction) for 3D image reconstruction from arbitrarily oriented 2D projection images

issue.body:
Hello,

I could not build ncempy on openSUSE Tumbleweed.
I am trying to submit genfire to openSUSE repository at the moment.
I tried installing python3-qt5 and python3-matplotlib-qt5 but the error still occur.

The dependency I install are:
```
Requires:       python3-Pillow 
Requires:       python3-PyQt5 
Requires:       python3-matplotlib 
Requires:       python3-numpy 
Requires:       python3-pyparsing 
Requires:       python3-scipy 
Requires:       python3-setuptools
Requires:       python3-pyFFTW
Requires:       python3-matplotlib-qt5
Requires:       python3-qt5
```

The error are shown below.
Thanks.

```
[    7s] running test

[    8s]   File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/unittest/loader.py", line 377, in _get_module_from_name
[    8s]     __import__(name)
```
